body.p: Which of the following best describes Moore's law?

multiple_choice.choice: The speed of a transistor doubles every 18 to 24 months.
The number of platters in a hard drive doubles every 18 to 24 months.
The number of transistors that can fit on an area of chip doubles every 18 to 24 months.
The cost for transistors reduces by half every 18 to 24 months.

response.feedback: Moore's law is about transistors, but it is not exactly about speed.
Moore's law is not about platters in hard drives.
Moore's law is about fitting more transistors per area of chip.
Moore's law is not about cost reduction.
